title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:07  has joined #xwiki 01:17  has joined #xwiki 01:18  has quit 01:25  has joined #xwiki 01:32  has left #xwiki 01:37  has quit 01:38  has quit 01:38  has joined #xwiki 01:51  has quit 01:53  has quit 04:20  has quit 05:03  has quit 05:04  has quit 05:07  has joined #xwiki 06:14  has joined #xwiki 06:14  has quit 06:14  has joined #xwiki 07:11  has joined #xwiki 07:28  has joined #xwiki 08:04  has quit 08:05  has joined #xwiki 09:24  has joined #xwiki 10:16  has joined #xwiki 10:16  has quit 10:16  is now known as 10:26  has joined #xwiki 10:38  has joined #xwiki 10:40  has joined #xwiki 10:42  has joined #xwiki 10:43  has quit 10:43  has quit 10:54  has quit 10:57  has joined #xwiki 11:16  has quit 11:41  has joined #xwiki 11:59  has joined #xwiki 12:07  has joined #xwiki 12:08  has left #xwiki 12:18  has quit 12:55  has quit 13:11  has joined #xwiki 13:16  has quit 13:39  has quit 14:09  has joined #xwiki 14:51  has quit 14:53  has joined #xwiki 14:55  has quit 15:20  has joined #xwiki 15:28  has quit 15:37  has quit 15:42  has joined #xwiki 16:03  has joined #xwiki 16:44  has left #xwiki 16:56  has quit 17:27  has joined #xwiki 17:34  cjdelisle: I see that we're loosing captcha on registration every time I upgrade myxwiki.org. However I don't upgrade xwikipreferences so my guess is that the params are stored somewhere else, on another page that should be excluded from the upgrade in the upgrade notes. 17:34  any idea? 17:35  since I've been doign this for all wikis, I guess I've broken a lot of them :( 17:35  I checked http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradingwikidocuments and couldn't see any such doc to exclude 17:36  ok found http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/RegistrationConfig I guess that's the one 17:36  are there other such pages? 17:37  for other admin features 17:39  Oh yes, InvitationConfig. Sorry about that, I'll add it. 17:39  already done 17:39  :) 17:39  ah no 17:39  I did RegConfig 17:39  ok please add it 17:39  see XWIKI-6189? 17:39  I'm addign both to the myxwiki.org upgrade instructions 17:42  done for myxwiki.org: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Upgrading 17:42  cjdelisle: you want me to do it for http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradingwikidocuments or are you on it? 17:43  Yes, I'm just checking that InvitationConfig is the name of the document first. 17:43  ok 17:43  btw this means that all (or most) of our wikis on myxwiki.org don't use captcha… I'll create a script to cehck that 17:47  thanks 17:48  Yea, I really need to carve out some time to do default config documents. 18:04  has joined #xwiki 18:04  has quit 18:35  has joined #xwiki 18:48  has joined #xwiki 19:04  has joined #xwiki 19:14  has quit 19:16  has quit 19:30  has joined #xwiki 19:30  has left #xwiki 19:32  has joined #xwiki 19:32  hello 19:32  hi 19:33  i wanna talk to thomas mortagne 19:34  Looks like he's not in this channel. 19:34  :) ohk.. 19:34  (right now) 19:34  He's usually around during the week though. 19:35  any idea,, wen he will be around 19:36  Probably monday. 19:38  ooh :( 19:47  has left #xwiki 21:06  has joined #xwiki 21:12  my understanding is that if I want to create documents in my wiki by importing XML (http://nvd.nist.gov/download/nvdcve-xmldoc.cfm) then I have to use groovy to parse the content... where would I find additional documentation to assist me?  my hope is to enable the programming, but write some code that will enable dynamic updates of the pages as modification to existing content will be necessary 21:15  I understand there is a script service for handling XML documents. 21:16  sdumitriu: Is the XMLScriptService documented anywhere? 21:18  has quit 21:18  hehe I'll take that as a no 21:20  has quit 21:23  has joined #xwiki 21:25  Anyway, there is this: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-xml/xwiki-xml-script/src/main/java/org/xwiki/xml/internal/XMLScriptService.java 21:25  I don't see any documentation on it. 21:25  It should allow you to put into a page: 21:26  {{velocity}} $services.xml.parse('

something

') {{/velocity}} 21:26  Which will return a org.w3c.dom.Document 21:30  has quit 21:37  would this implementation support xwiki page creation/updating from an xml feed? 21:38   sorry I missed out on the initial part of your response... darned guest wifi here at the hospital cut me off and I only received your reply starting with "Anyway, there is this:" 21:39  You would have to create the document programmtically 21:39  http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/users/2010-February/019480.html 21:39  There is a description of how to create documents using script. 21:39  16:29 <+cjdelisle> Anyway, there is this: 21:39  http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-xml/xwiki-xml-script/src/main/java/org/xwiki/xml/internal/XMLScriptService.java 21:40   ahh, thanks for that 21:40  ^that is the code to a parser which is included in xwiki and will allow you to parse and manipulate XML documents. 21:41  did you get this part? 21:41  16:30 <+cjdelisle> {{velocity}} $services.xml.parse('

something

') {{/velocity}} 21:41  yes, thank you... so as i understand this... the content is created upon the instance the page is accessed? 21:42  You're talking about getDocument()? 21:43  i.e. not so similar to the RESTful API's use of PUT/POST methods 21:44  I'm not sure which you are talking about. are you refering to "how to create the document programmtically"? 21:45  I shall read more and respond with something hopefully a little more intellectual 21:45  very much appreciate the push in the direction here 21:45  Sure thing, always feel free to ask. 21:52  has joined #xwiki 21:56  has joined #xwiki 22:08  has quit 22:10  has joined #xwiki 22:42   RE: XMLScriptService.java ...this looks to be a Utility class... however this looks to only have static methods.  Not so sure this would work but will continue reading.  I am hopeful this might still somehow fit a use case similar to "we need someone to integrate an XML feed which provides inventory." 22:43 <@sdumitriu> bbc581: It can be used from the wiki, from Velocity scripts 22:43 <@sdumitriu> $services.xml.parse($content) 22:45  ahh.. thanks for that 22:45  has joined #xwiki 22:45  has quit 23:04  has joined #xwiki 23:14  has quit 23:18  has quit
